timeline.bodyText: These updates should probably be made within a transaction.
timeline.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: JdbcTemplates are thread safe. This class really should only ever have a single instance: https://docs.spring.io/spring/docs/current/spring-framework-reference/data-access.html#jdbc-JdbcTemplate-idioms
timeline.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: Couldn't there be other reasons a BadSqlGrammerException is thrown that don't indicate the table already exists? Does the table already exists exception have an error code? This may also vary between db implementations. Can you use a CREATE ... IF NOT EXISTS construct?
timeline.author: pwinckles

replies.bodyText:
So there is a wrapped exception, but it is from the database layer which in the test case is h2. If you wire a postgresql or mysql I imagine it will be different.
I can certainly add the h2 exceptions here and once we start wiring in more robust database engines we can extend the catch?
replies.author: whikloj

replies.bodyText: Alternatively I can re-add the isTableMissing function?
replies.author: whikloj

replies.bodyText: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS seems most straightforward from my perspective.  Then there won't be any "happy" exceptions to explicitly ignore.
replies.author: birkland

timeline.message: More changes and some code review

timeline.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: There are multiple places throughout this class where literals are used ("child", "parent", transactionId). Should probably use the static constants defined at the top of the class.
timeline.author: awoods

replies.bodyText:
So technically the child here matches to the :child part of the SQL statement in.
"SELECT * FROM " + RESOURCES_TABLE + " WHERE " + FEDORA_ID_COLUMN + " = :child"

So we don't want to use the constants, but perhaps using a more descriptive name to differentiate between columns and arguments?
replies.author: whikloj

replies.bodyText: To clarify, the above was a question. I'm not going to mess around with all the various SQL statements unless its required.
replies.author: whikloj

replies.bodyText:
I was not thinking of the SQL statements, but rather the String literals used in calls to parameterSource.addValue(). It seems more maintainable if "parent", "child" and "transactionId" were replaced by constants.
Searching for "parameterSource.addValue(" shows 12 instances.
replies.author: awoods

replies.bodyText:
To recap the Slack discussion, the replacing of literals with constants would work for the literals parent and transactionId due to them (fortuitously) being the same as the constants, however child would have to remain as a literal or be modified or have a new constant defined.
I'm not against this work, but I also don't see it as valuable and would prefer to push it off for now.
replies.author: whikloj
